title: A JSON Schema for x-ms-examples extension in Swagger 2.0 API.
description: Describes the format of an example defined using the x-ms-examples extension.

operationId.description: The operationId in the swagger specification for which the example is being provided.

title.description: The title in the swagger spec that uniquely identifies the swagger spec.

description.description: A brief explanation about the current scenario.

responses.description: A dictionary of {possible HTTP status codes (as the dictionary key)} that can be received from that operation and {examples (as the dictionary value)} of response {body} and {headers (for long running operations)}.

xmsParametersExample.description: A dictionary of parameter names and their sample values for a particular operation. Commonly used parameters in Azure, like 'api-version', 'subscriptionId' and 'resourceGroupName' have been defined as optional properties for ease of use. Please add other parameters as applicable in your example.

api-version.description: An example of the api-version used in the request.

subcriptionId.description: An example of the subcriptionId used in the request.

resourceGroupName.description: An example of the resourceGroupName used in the request.

xmsResponseHeaderExample.description: Examples of response headers. Common response headers like 'location', 'azure-asyncoperation', 'retry-after', etc. are defined as optional properties for ease of use. Please feel free to add other response headers as applicable in the example.

location.description: An example of the location header sent by the server, if applicable in the example.

azure-asyncoperation.description: An example of the azure-asyncoperation header sent by the server, if applicable in the example.

retry-after.description: An example value of the retry-after header sent by the server, if applicable in the example.

xmsResponseExample.description: Describes headers and body of an example HTTP response, in the context of the x-ms-examples extension.

body.description: Example of the response body if applicable for the operation. Don't specify the body if the server is not sending a response body. The outcome from `JSON.parse()`, needs to be described over here.
